<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: EmbeddedObject attachment = body.getEmbeddedObject("Request.xlsx");
if (attachment != null) {
    System.out.println("Found Request.xlsx in " + doc.getItemValueString("Subject"));
}
<<<explanation>>>: In the code snippet provided, you are checking if the "Body" item has an embedded object named "Request.xlsx". If it does, you print a message indicating that the attachment was found.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: EmbeddedObject attachment = (EmbeddedObject) body.getEmbeddedObject("Request.xlsx");
if (attachment != null) {
    // Do something with the attachment
}
<<<explanation>>>: In Lotus Notes, attachments are stored as EmbeddedObjects within the RichTextItem. You can use the getEmbeddedObject() method to retrieve the attachment object. If the attachment exists, you can then perform operations on it.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: EmbeddedObject attachment = body.getEmbeddedObject("Request.xlsx");
if (attachment != null) {
    System.out.println("Found Request.xlsx in " + doc.getItemValueString("Subject"));
    // Do something with the attachment
}
<<<explanation>>>: In Lotus Notes, attachments are stored as EmbeddedObjects in RichTextItems. You can use the getEmbeddedObject method of the RichTextItem class to retrieve the attachment by its name. If the attachment exists, you can then perform any necessary operations on it.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: EmbeddedObject attachment = (EmbeddedObject) body.getEmbeddedObjects().next();
<<<explanation>>>: To get all the attachments from a Lotus Notes database, you can use the getEmbeddedObjects() method of the RichTextItem class. This method returns an Iterator of EmbeddedObject. You can then use the next() method of the Iterator to get each attachment.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: EmbeddedObject attachment = (EmbeddedObject) body.getEmbeddedObjects().next();
<<<explanation>>>: To get all the attachments from a .nsf file, you can use the getEmbeddedObjects() method of the RichTextItem class. This method returns an Iterator of all the embedded objects in the RichTextItem. You can then use the next() method of the Iterator to get each attachment one by one.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: EmbeddedObject attachment = (EmbeddedObject) body.getEmbeddedObject("Request.xlsx");
